natural solution: We solve the equation $f(x) = 0$ on the domains $x \le 1$ and $x > 1.$ If $x \le 1,$ then $f(x) = -x - 3,$ so we want to solve $-x - 3 = 0.$ The solution is $x = -3,$ which satisfies $x \le 1.$ If $x > 1,$ then $f(x) = \frac{x}{2} + 1,$ so we want to solve $\frac{x}{2} + 1 = 0.$ The solution is $x = -2,$ but this value does not satisfy $x > 1.$
